results.title: Statin monotherapy attenuates renal injury in a salt-sensitive hypertension model of renal disease.
results.text_hl: Serum @CHEMICAL_Cholesterol @CHEMICAL_MESH:D002784 @@@cholesterol@@@ level did not change with @<m>CHEMICAL_Simvastatin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D019821 @@@SIMV@@@. CONCLUSION: @<m>CHEMICAL_Simvastatin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D019821 @@@SIMV@@@ attenuated @DISEASE_Fibrosis @DISEASE_MESH:D005355 @@@interstitial fibrosis@@@ associated with this model of @<m>DISEASE_Hypertension_Renal</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D006977 @@@hypertensive renal disease@@@.

citations.NLM: Vieira JM Jr, Rodrigues LT, Mantovani E, Dellê H, Mattar AL, Malheiros DM, Noronha IL, Fujihara CK, Zatz R. Statin monotherapy attenuates renal injury in a salt-sensitive hypertension model of renal disease. Nephron Physiol. 2005;101(4):p82-91. PMID: 16113589

results.title: Simvastatin ameliorates angiotensin II-induced endothelial dysfunction through restoration of Rho-BH4-eNOS-NO pathway.
results.text_hl: We previously found that @<m>CHEMICAL_Simvastatin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D019821 @@@simvastatin@@@ moderately decreases blood pressure in 2-kidney@CELLLINE_CVCL:A628 @@@-2-clip@@@ (@CELLLINE_CVCL:0302 @@@2k2c@@@) @<m>DISEASE_Hypertension_Renal</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D006977 @@@renal hypertension@@@, but the precise mechanisms are still unclear.

citations.NLM: Zhang Z, Wang M, Xue SJ, Liu DH, Tang YB. Simvastatin ameliorates angiotensin II-induced endothelial dysfunction through restoration of Rho-BH4-eNOS-NO pathway. Cardiovasc Drugs Ther. 2012 Feb;26(1):31-40. PMID: 22083280
